body.p: For similar reasons, the IASB decided to include variable lease payments that depend on an index or a rate in the measurement of lease liabilities. Those payments meet the definition of liabilities for the lessee because they are unavoidable and do not depend on any future activity of the lessee. Any uncertainty, therefore, relates to the measurement of the liability that arises from those payments and not to the existence of that liability.
